message: I'm looking for automatic deduping and automatic tagging
i've never trusted any automated utility with my itunes collection... i do it by manual inspection
I use TuneUp and I love it - http://www.tuneupmedia.com/
I know there's lots of good stuff at http://dougscripts.com/itunes/
Worth a shot, but I don't think it's free.  http://www.tidysongs.com/
@vinnycarpenter We tried tuneup but couldn't figure out how to get it to remove dupes

I tried Tidysongs.  I thought "gee their site looks all put together & modern; maybe they can cleanup my mp3 mess."  I was dreaming. Tidysongs made a much bigger mess out of my 65gigs of music.  From there I used iTunes sorting capabilities to find & edit chunks of stuff over several days.  That was a year or two back.  Tidysongs gave me my money back, but Danny Sullivan had trouble getting his cash back.  His experience: http://daggle.com/reasons-avoid-tidysongs-clickbank-2413

I created a simple Automator workflow to get rid of dupes that iTunes itself created (since it always adds +# to the end of a duplicate upon re-import). From there I used TuneUp for tagging/tidying up. It's cool but very slow if your library is big (I'm probably an edge case at ~480 GB though).
if just for music, you can simply find any mp3 tag editor (like mp3tag that I uses on Windows) since it is just basically the same stuff. then you do your own way of refreshing your library
